result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus S Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus S Diaz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus S Diaz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Marcus S Diaz was found guilty of False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid as a condition of Probation in ct 3.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
AODA and treatment/counseling as recommended. Should be in some sort of treatment/counseling for the entire length of probation.
AODA and treatment/counseling as recommended. Should be in some sort of treatment/counseling for the entire length of probation.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with FD, VD or RD if Def has any alcohol in his system.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. Shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol. Shall not reside anywhere there is alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Consec to 17CF2639.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
11/15/2019 Crt orders 15CF9 no longer consec to 17CF2639. 17CF2639 now consec to 15CF9.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL, any IID requirement and written approval of agent.   Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with wife or children without written permission of agent.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. May not live anywhere there is alcohol. May not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
Completion of certified domestic violence treatment. Random searches of home, car or possessions for alcohol.  Random UA & BA testing at min of once/week.
